title: SLC rewards U19 players with 100,000 each
snippet: Sri Lanka Cricket rewarded 26 players of the U19 squad with a financial assistance of LKR 100,000 each for the commitment shown for the game.The U19 team is currently undergoing training focusing on the upcoming inbound tours,

title: Sri Lanka inflation at 5.7-pct in September 2021, food prices soar
snippet: Sri Lanka's inflation in the capital Colombo was 5.7 percent in the 12-month to September, slowing from 6.0 in July, though prices rose 0.4 percent during the month, data from the state debt office showed.

title: Lasith Dassanayake was an excellent boxer

title: Galle Fort's Exotic Roots
snippet: Galle Fort artist Catherine H believes "The core of the human life is love" something she has practiced since her free spirited childhood and summer holidays in Carnac, the South Coast of Brittany France,

title: Colombo City Centre celebrates third Anniversary
snippet: Colombo City Centre, the premier luxury lifestyle destination of Sri Lanka, celebrated its 3rd anniversary on September 19, having achieved many accomplishments and laurels despite the numerous obstacles and challenging times faced especially during these three years.

title: Avishka happy as Under-19 squad pass fitness test
snippet: Reemus Fernando     Sri Lanka Under-19 coach Avishka Gunawardene said that he was extremely happy with the progress made by his charges during the training camp ahead of the team's first international series against Bangladesh this month.

title: Sri Lanka killing US$1.3bn export industry to save US$30mn
snippet: Sri Lanka's tea exports which brings 1.3 billion US dollars a year could lose 40 percent of output from a fertilizer ban which will save 30 million dollars, a industry official said amid a state imposed ban on agro-chemicals.

title: Emphasis on Under-19 cricket commendable
snippet: Rex Clementine Since reaching the finals of the ICC Youth World Cup in the year 2000 under the captaincy of Malintha Gajanayaka, Sri Lanka Under-19 have struggled to make an impact in the tournament although several players involved in the competition have gone onto have an impact with the senior side.

snippet: The Central Bank, under the instructions of newly appointed Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal, will take such steps among others to replenish dwindling foreign reserves of the country. ..

title: GSP+ withdrawal: How would it impact Sri Lanka's economy?
snippet: By Asanka Wijesinghe and Eleesha Munasinghe Sri Lanka's preferential access to the vital European Union (EU) market faces fresh challenges after the European Parliament's special resolution adopted in June 2021.

title: ComBank conducts e-forum series to encourage citizens overseas to invest in Sri Lanka
snippet: The Commercial Bank of Ceylon has stepped up efforts to encourage Sri Lankans living overseas to invest in Sri Lanka with the support of the country's benchmark private bank. The Bank has launched a series of e-forums designed to create awareness about local investment opportunities available to Sri Lankans living or working in other countries

title: Sri Lanka lifts island-wide quarantine curfew
snippet: The island-wide quarantine curfew in Sri Lanka, which was in effect for over a month, was lifted at 4.00 a.m. today (October 01). The government decided to ease restrictions on movement as the country started seeing a considerable drop in the number of daily COVID-19 cases and deaths reported.

title: Janaprith Fernando assumes duties as chief scout commissioner
snippet: Attorney-at-Law Janaprith Fernando will assume duties as the 21st Chief Commissioner of the Sri Lanka Scout Association (SLSA) today. ..

title: Australia to reopen border from November
snippet: Australia will reopen its international border from November, allowing vaccinated travellers into the country for the first time in 18 months. ..

title: Sri Lanka relaxes six-week COVID-19 "lockdown", but some restrictions remain
snippet: Sri Lanka's six-week COVID-19 lockdown, or 'quarantine curfew' as it is officially known, was relaxed Friday (01) morning, though some restrictions such as an inter-provincial travel ban remain. The health ministry issued new guidelines on Thursday (30) to be followed by the public in the coming weeks in order to prevent a fresh wave of daily cases which have seen a gradual decline over the past few weeks.

title: Sri Lanka lifts 6-week virus lockdown amid economic worries

title: Organic vegetable farming successful in Naula, but farmers lament no good price
snippet: A group of farmers in Naula of the Matale district have successfully cultivated vegetables such as Knol khol with organic fertilizer. Farmer Y.G. Somapala, 64, says he has reported a bumper crop without any hassle by applying only organic inputs.

title: Sri Lanka lifts 6-week virus lockdown amid economic worries
snippet: Sri Lanka lifted a six-week lockdown Friday as COVID-19 cases and deaths decline but will restrict people's movement for work and obtaining essentials only — which are running short in the island country amid economic worries.

title: Sri Lanka lifts 6-week virus lockdown amid economic worries
snippet: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lanka lifted a six-week lockdown Friday as COVID-19 cases and deaths decline but will restrict people's movement for work and obtaining essentials only — which are running short in the island country amid economic worries.

title: Bengaluru-based spice brand Rockbee to multiply business across Dubai, Malaysia; To enter E-Commerce, 2021 11:03 am

title: Sri Lanka to consider buying back ISBs falling due in 2022: Governor Cabraal
snippet: Sri Lanka will consider buying back some of the international sovereign bonds due in 2021, if they continue to trade at steep discounts, Central Bank Governor Nivard Cabraal said, promising no default.

title: World Bank approves US $500Mn loan for Sri Lanka

title: Cambodia bans telecast of LTTE "Methagu" film

title: Circular issued recalling state sector employees for work
